result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clayton T Sims

Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Make all court appearances on time. Do not drive at all.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Clayton T Sims appeared by video, in custody, Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Clayton T Sims. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Defense moves to dismiss count 2 with argument.
State objects with argument.
BTC: Motion to dismiss denied. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
